iati-activity.description: SUPPORT TO NORWEGIAN PEOPLE'S AID MINE ACTION PROGRAMME IN ETHIOPIA.

iati-activity.title: INTEGRATED RURAL DEVELOPMENT PROJECT
iati-activity.description: THE AIM OF THIS PROJECT IS TO ENHANCE THE FOOD SECURITY AND QUALITY OF LIFE OF THE TARGET GROUP BY INCREASING FARMING, ENHANCING HEALTHCARE OF FAMILIES OF THE POPULATION IN THE AREA AND BY OFFERING A BETTER CHANCE FOR EDUCATION.

iati-activity.title: STRENGTHENING THE SDPRP MONITORING AND EVALUATION SYSTEM
iati-activity.description: THE GOAL OF THE PROJECT IS TO CONTRIBUTE TO A BETTER AND MORE BROAD-BASED MONITORING AND EVALUATION OF SDPRP AND THE MILLENNIUM DEVELOPMENT GOALS.

iati-activity.title: RURAL WATER SUPPLY AND ENVIRONMENTAL PROJECT IN ETHIOPIA
iati-activity.description: THE OVERALL OBJECTIVE OF THE PROJECT IS TO BUILD THE CAPACITY OF THE COMMUNITIES TO INITIATE, MANAGE AND IMPLEMENT THEIR PRIORITY PROJECTS WITH THE SUPPORT FROM WOREDAS IN AMHARA REGION AND OTHER REGIONS IN ETHIOPIA. THE PURPOSE IS TO ACHIEVE AN INSTITUTI
iati-activity.sector: Basic drinking water supply and basic sanitation

iati-activity.title: NGO SUPPORT / DEAF WOMEN'S EMPOWERMENT AND HIV/AIDS PREVENTION
iati-activity.description: ETHIOPIAN DEAF WOMEN'S EMPOWERMENT AND HIV/AIDS PREVENTION PROJECT

iati-activity.title: NGO SUPPORT / CHILDREN'S NUTRITION AND FAMILY EMPOWERMENT
iati-activity.description: CHILDREN WHO OFTEN ARE MALNOURISHED WILL BE SUPPORTED BY PROVIDING NUTRITION AND OTHER KINDS OF SUPPORT FOR THEM.

iati-activity.title: Rural Water Supply, Sanitation and Hygiene Programme
iati-activity.description: The overall (long term) objective of the Programme is âuniversal access to improved water source, sanitation and hygiene in Benishangul-Gumuzâ. The achievement of the overall objective is beyond the scope of the Programme alone. However, WASH-Beni is expected to have substantial contribution, in parallel with other undertakings, to the achievement the universal access on a sustainable basis with communities being capable of managing their water points from planning to replacement investments.
iati-activity.sector: Basic drinking water supply and basic sanitation

iati-activity.title: Support to Special Needs Education Program in Ethiopia
iati-activity.description: The programme aims at strengthening and mainstreaming special needs education in education sector in Ethiopia.

iati-activity.title: Integrated Watershed Management in Ethiopia
iati-activity.description: The Watershed Management Project in Ethiopia has emerged form the Nile Basin Initiative and is linked Eastern Nile Subsidiary Action Project. The complementarity aims of the project are to lift the communities out of the poverty trap they are in by raising their productivity whilst promoting sustainable use of the landscape and natural resources. This in turn is expected to lead to reduced erosion to the benefit of downstream users.

iati-activity.title: NGO Support / Inclusive Education Programme for Children w. Disabilities
iati-activity.description: Children with disabilities is one of the most vulnerable and marginalized groups in Ethiopia. They are very poorly provided opportunities for school going and educating themselves. Without basic education and knowledge of their rights these children are in even greater risk to be abused and maltreated. The objective of this project is a favourable and supportative environment for 208 children with disabilities to access schools in the three rural Kebeles of Debre Zeit town. At the moment very few of them goes to school due to social, physical and financial barriers. This project will crush these barriers by different awareness raising, anti stigmatizing campaigning to community members, children, parents and teachers of disabled children; advocating disability issues among the officials; offering the children rehabilitation and appliances; and by supporting income generating of families.

iati-activity.title: NGO Support / Be strong - Empowerment of disabled women and EWDNA
iati-activity.description: The project aims to improve the life situation of Ethiopian women with disabilities through strengthening their national organisation EWDNA.

iati-activity.title: NGO Support / Empowerment of Disability Movement in Ethiopia
iati-activity.description: The project aims to improve the life situations of Persons With Disabilities through strengthening the capacity of their organisations, partner is EFPD, Ethiopian Federation of Persons with Disabilities. Awareness on poverty reduction strategies, organizational development, advocacy and human rights, and accessibility training.

iati-activity.title: Frame agreement with NGO (Fida Int.)
iati-activity.description: HIV/AIDS Programme in Debre Zeit. The programme aims to influence the attitudes of the people in Debre Zeit Town towards people living with HIV/AIDS (PLWHA) in a way that will result in a positive change both in terms of attitude and behaviour. Fida partners with the Ethiopian Guenet Church (EGC) and its Development and Welfare Organization (DWO). The programme provides comprehensive support to the PLWHAs in Debre Zeit Town. Fida and EGC/DWO offer income-generation possibilities to people with HIV/AIDS and their families as well as psychosocial support to orphans. In addition_ the partners organize e.g. awareness-raising events_ offer information materials to local schools and train peer educators. Through the support_ training and awareness-raising activities offered by the programme the overall understanding of the HIV/AIDS question in Debre Zeit will improve. This will have a positive effect on their attitude and behaviour towards the PLWHAs. The increased knowledge and behavioural change will_ in turn_ reduce the negative impact of HIV/AIDS on the lives of those infected or otherwise affected by it.

iati-activity.title: Frame agreement with NGO (Suomen Lahetysseura ry)
iati-activity.description: Training the teachers for deafs. Education of the teachers for deaf. Awareness raising on the situation of the deaf.

iati-activity.description: Literature and Adult Education. Literacy education both to adults and children.

iati-activity.description: Danito Yeri Rural Community Development Project. Development of small rural communities in Kaffa area: minorities rights_ women_ basic health knowledge_ clean water.

iati-activity.title: Frame agreement with NGO (Suomen Lahetysseura ry)
iati-activity.description: New Rural Community Development Project. Developing the community's standard of living: drilling dwells, health services, literature education.

iati-activity.title: NGO Support / Support,empowerment of disabled students in Addis Ababa
iati-activity.description: At the University of Addis Ababa there are few hundred students with disabilities. They have formed two committees one of the visually impaired and the other off physically impaired. The project aims to increase the awareness of the students, strengthen their organizing and facilitate and support the studies and everyday life of the students.

iati-activity.title: NGO Support / Education, family income and environmental project Jimma
iati-activity.description: The project targets to reduce poverty by offering children basis for their life through primary education and adult people new sustainable and locally based livelihoods.

location.name: Ethiopia, Oromia, Jimma Zone; Limu Saka, Limu Cosa and Chora Boter Woredas

iati-activity.sector: Multisector aid for basic social services

iati-activity.title: Water Supply and Sanitation Programme support through World Bank
iati-activity.description: The overall goal of the program is to assist key sector stakeholders in the Regional states of Ethiopia in the development of viable, decentralized sector wide approach to facilitate national 2012 targets of universal access. This goal will be achieved by supporting multistakeholder regional coordination, policy dialogue, planning, budgeting, capacity building as well as by assisting to develop a sector information and monitoring system in the country.
iati-activity.sector: Water resources policy and administrative management

iati-activity.title: Water supply; Sanitation and Hygiene Capacity Building
iati-activity.description: The proposed WASH CBPF is a joint financing arrangement to channel aid support to the capacity building (CB) needs of the Ethiopian water, sanitation and hygiene sectors with special reference to a national sector investment program called Universal Access Program (UAP). It has a three-year budget of about EUR 10 million of which the proposed Finnish contribution is EUR 2.2 million. The CBPF addresses the identified capacity gap in the WASH sub-sector. The purpose of the WASH CBPF is âto harmonise CB initiatives for the WASH sector in Ethiopia, aligned with Government policies and plans, with greater overall impact at reduced transaction costsâ.
iati-activity.sector: Water resources policy and administrative management

iati-activity.title: Administrative costs at MFA from the Embassy of Finland in Addis Abeba
iati-activity.description: Administrative costs at MFA, related to ODA. These costs cover all costs that can be counted (in full or percentually) as ODA at the Ministry for Foreign Affairs in Finland. Administrative costs at MFA from the Embassy of Finland in Addis Abeba

iati-activity.title: NGO Support / Diversified and developed options of rural livelihoods in Jimma zone
iati-activity.description: The project targets to reduce poverty by offering for the men and women in the rural area new sustainable and locally based livelihood options. The project aims to make land available for all year cultivation through irrigation constructions. Testing the oil production from castor bean. Training in beekeeping and honey production.

iati-activity.title: NGO Support / Improvement of self-sufficiency and sustainability in sanitation waste
iati-activity.description: To improve the participatory planning and implementation process of local waste management and sanitary conditions in Bahar Dar City
iati-activity.sector: Water supply and sanitation - large systems

iati-activity.title: Frame agreement with NGO (Plan Finland)
iati-activity.description: Integrated Management of Childhood Illnesses. To ensure childrenâs right to survival and development by enabling mothers and care-takers to prevent communicable diseases and malnutrition among children under five; building health systemâs capacity to provide good quality services; by building children and their parentsâ capacity to participate

iati-activity.title: Frame agreement with NGO (Plan Finland)
iati-activity.description: Supporting Local Structures to Prevent the Spread and Mitigate the Impact of HIC and Aids. To decrease the risk of getting infected by HIV among poor and marginalized people and to improve OVCâ and affected familiesâ access to care_ treatment and mitigation services

iati-activity.title: Frame agreement with NGO (Pelastakaa lapset)
iati-activity.description: Equitable quality basic education for children in Ethiopia. The purpose of the project is that all children_ including children with disabilities have access to quality education in the intervention areas. This is achieved throuhg 1) increased opportunities to children to attend primary schools_ 2) improved standard of primary education and school environment and involvement of community members_etc in education and childrenâs wellbeing_ 3) improved EO_s capacity to meet the educational needs of children and 4) improved awareness of focal federal government offices on inclusive education. During the project 11 000 children will get opportunity to enroll to school.

iati-activity.title: Frame agreement with NGO (Pelastakaa lapset)
iati-activity.description: Ethiopia: child protection from labour_ abuse and exploitation. The purpose of the project is that child labor and exploitation and gender based violence in SCF project areas has reduced. This is achieved through 1) increased childrenâs activity and visibility in child rights issues_ 2) improved capacity of child related government offices to protect and handle cases of child exploitation or GBV_ 3) enhanced capacity of communities_ CBOs and the media to protect children from exploitation and GBV. About 200 000 children will benefit from the project.

iati-activity.title: Frame agreement with NGO (Pelastakaa lapset)
iati-activity.description: Ethiopia_ Alaba right to water. Childrenâs and communityâs access to water and sanitation in the context of the current emergency situation is improved_ and their survival and well-being is enhanced.
iati-activity.sector: Basic drinking water supply and basic sanitation

iati-activity.title: Frame agreement with NGO (Pelastakaa lapset)
iati-activity.description: B4 Programme support to country programme in Ethiopia.

iati-activity.title: Frame agreement with NGO (Pelastakaa lapset)
iati-activity.description: Country Reprsentative_ Ethiopia.

iati-activity.title: Support to Teacher Development Programme
iati-activity.description: Support to Teacher Development Programme_ phase II (2008-2010). Support through basket funding.

iati-activity.title: Frame Agreement with NGO (Finnish Red Cross)
iati-activity.description: Integrated Health programme . To improve the lives and the general health and sanitation conditions of vulnerable communities through the promotion of the community based health care and water and sanitation activities.

iati-activity.title: NGO Support / HIV/AIDS Prevention, care and support project of Jimma town and zone
iati-activity.description: Enable the HIV victims to become self reliant and contributing members of society, offering food, medical help and life skills. Communicating with high risk women and youths and engaging in self reliance program of small scale business. To achieve behavioural change by producing relevant material and organizing training. Enabling the community to know the status of HIV/AIDS of it's members by organizing voluntary counselling and testing program.

iati-activity.title: Support to Land Administration
iati-activity.description: The Overall Objective of the Finnish support sub-programme, which would be adopted directly from ESIF (Ethiopia Sustainable Land Management Investment Framework), will focus to livelihoods and economic well-being of rural population promoting sustainable land management practises. The sub-programme promotes enabling policy, legal, institutional, and financial framework for land administration, build capacity for an entry-level land administration in the Benishangul-Gumuz region, support sustainable 1st and 2nd level land certification in areas-with-high-potential-for-investments and enhance responsible land delivery for investments.

iati-activity.title: Education Pool Fund II
iati-activity.description: Education Pooled Fund is a jointly-funded initiative as a partnership between MOE and pooled funding partners, managed by UNDP, with the goal of improving the effectiveness of the delivery of Education Sector Development Plans.

iati-activity.title: Agro-BIG; Programme for Agro-Business Induced Growth in Amhara
iati-activity.description: The overall objective of Agro-BIG is to contribute to poverty reduction through agriculture based economic growth in the Tana Beles growth corridor. It aims to achieve three main outcomes: (1) improved access of small holder farmers to, and increased value adding in the selected value chains; (2) improved on-farm productivity and quality of produce; (3) strengthened capacity of public and private sector institutions to support the selected value chains. The purpose of AGROBIG is âto increase value addition of selected agricultural commodities through improved production and post harvest practices as well as processing among male and female small holders and cooperativesâ. The Programme will work with a market-led value chain approach, thus supporting capacity building of all stakeholders along the value chain to facilitate improved market access for selected crops and livestock products.

location.name: Tana Beles growth corridor in Amhara National Regional State (Ethiopia)

iati-activity.title: Capacity Building for Accelerated Geoinformation Production
iati-activity.description: The overall purpose of the project is to support mineral sector development that enables it to contribute for the economic growth of the country. The objective of the project is strengthening the GSE by developing modern GIS and remote sensing technology facilities and geoinformation management infrastructure. The planned activities include capacity building and upgrading regional geosciences data quality and coverage.

iati-activity.title: Evaluation of the Finnish Country Programme with Etiopia
iati-activity.description: The Finnish Country Programme with Ethiopia will be evaluated parallel with the European Commission's respective evaluation, however with separate tasks. The proposal came from the siden of the EC. The purpose of the evaluation of the MFA, Development evaluation/EVA-11 is to assess the relevance, coherence, complementarity, sustainability and impact of the Finnish aid to Etiopia against the development plans and needs of Ethiopia and the aid actitivities of other donors.

iati-activity.description: Fuga community empowerment (KMG) in Ethiopia. KMG works against genital mutilation.

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Ethiopia
iati-activity.description: Integrated community based rehabilitation for persons with disabilities (Cheshire Services-Ethiopia), for Harrer and Dire Dawa towns

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Ethiopia
iati-activity.description: Publication of articles,policy documents,good practices and comments that facilitate the enhancement of benchmarking, standards and quality of Ethiopian Legal Education. Provision of new and critical insights in to domestic and international law. Also caters the needs of students for a quick reference of summary notes on various topics.
iati-activity.sector: Basic life skills for youth and adults

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Ethiopia
iati-activity.description: Enable 150 school age children with disabilities to attend their schooling in regular schools in 3 targeted towns through home to home interventions and school based support. Enable 50 persons with disabilities to be self-reliant through micro business and urban agriculture skills in targeted 3 towns. Organize also 6 days capacity building training for 15 senior micro finance institutions and development partners to mainstream disability in targeted towns.

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Ethiopia
iati-activity.description: Conduct environmental workshops for students, teachers and NGO staff. Rehabilitate selected area and create a permanent demonstration site for recycling and waste management. Undertake tree planting campaign in Addis Abeba, Ambo and Holleta. Organize environment information centres and paintings in schools.

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Ethiopia
iati-activity.description: Promote urban agriculture as a source of income and food for the poor population through awareness raising, networking and lobbying. Introduce beneficiaries to business skills to orient urban agriculture activities to market based promotion of urban agriculture based self help group approach and Documentation of interventions.

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Ethiopia
iati-activity.description: Improve care and support for children including disabled at early childhood development (ECD)stages and ensure appropriate physical,emotional and mental development through provision of psychosocial support to parents and their children. Decrease the prevalence of child abuse in the community through establishment and enhancement of Gender clubs in 5 schools. Organize 30 parents under Income Generation Schemes. Train 5 Community Based Rehabilitation Workers (CBRWs)from youth to coordinate, monitor and provide services to beneficiary children and parents in targeted communities.

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Ethiopia
iati-activity.description: 470 young children in conflict with the law in Eastern Shoa zone will be successfully reintegrated using community based diversion program. Conduct training for 22 judges,prosecutors,correction officers,police,women&children, affairs officials, local community structures and other members of the community on treatment/development and rehabilitation of young children in conflict with the law. Establish special unit for care and development of children in conflict with the law. Establish a new girls wing juvenile correction centre in Adama prison and strengthen the established male's wing providing vocational trainings,education,..in same place.

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Ethiopia
iati-activity.description: Bring a long lasting change in the life of destitute mothers and children in Wolliso town through provision of services in vegetable gardening,sheep/cow rearing,and bee keeping. Render trainings on leadership skill for group leaders. Marketing and customer handling including quality of products and refresher training on vegetable gardening to beneficiary mothers to assure continuity of the project. Support for Orphan and Vulnerable Children(OVCs)by providing educational materials including school uniforms. Support for 23 People Living With HIV/AIDS: skill training & technical support. Strengthen Self-Help Groups(SHGs)through Income Generation Projects.

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Ethiopia
iati-activity.description: Strengthen youth and local authorities relationships through different trainings in Chefe Donsa,Leku and Holleta and Addis Abeba. Conduct two sessions: social trainings for 4080 youth in Chefe Donsa(5days each). Give 3 days technical training for 35 youth in organic urban agriculture and tree nursery management, business and financial training for 40 youth, 5 days advocacy and fund raising training for 40 youth in Chefedonsa. Sponsor youth groups to conduct their own workshops and give summer tutor for the local kids.

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Ethiopia
iati-activity.description: Integrated Capacity Building and Training Program (CLCBS), enhancing womenâs leadership

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Ethiopia
iati-activity.description: The production and supply for Braille books and publications, empowering the blind through increased access to printed sources of information in the Braille format.

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Ethiopia
iati-activity.description: Unspecified Project. Amount that is not allocated.

iati-activity.title: Support for institutionalising the CDF mechanism in Ethiopia
iati-activity.description: Finland intends to to provide GoE strategic technical and financial support for mainstreaming and scaling up the use of Community Development Fund (CDF) on federal level. The key feature of CDF is that it transfers funds and project management responsibilities for physical construction directly to communities via a micro credit institution. The communities are fully responsible for the development process through planning, implememntation and maintenance. The results of CDF have been promising.
iati-activity.sector: Basic drinking water supply and basic sanitation
